definition: to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum
to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
variant of 燙|烫[tang4]/variant of 趟[tang4]

sentences.english: Oscillating along the track of time, we sea our insignificant.
sentences.chinese: 摆荡在时间的轨迹，个人者发现自己何其渺小。

sentences.english: A weather front is blowing in, and his thick wool cape flutters behind him.
sentences.chinese: 山风呼啸，他那厚重的羊毛披肩往身后急速的摆荡。

sentences.english: However, I believe a designer should like to rock, especially brain rock.
sentences.chinese: 但我相信创意人应该喜爱摆荡，尤其脑力摆荡。

sentences.english: However, I believe a designer should like to rock, especially brain rock.
sentences.chinese: 但我相信创意人应该喜爱摆荡，尤其脑力摆荡。

sentences.english: The couple dangled their toes in the pond.
sentences.chinese: 那对情侣将脚趾摆荡在池塘里。

sentences.english: Oscillating along the track of time we see our insignificance.
sentences.chinese: 摆荡在时间的轨迹，个人都发现自己何其渺小。

sentences.english: Iran and the United States have been going through what might be described as diplomatic mood swings.
sentences.chinese: 伊朗和美国正在经历著一场“外交情绪摆荡”。

sentences.english: We need to avoid destabilizing, short-term swings in policy.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须避免政策的不稳定与短期摆荡。

sentences.english: Oscillating along the track of time, we see our insignificance.
sentences.chinese: 摆荡在时间的轨迹，个人都发现自己何自渺小。

definition: to sway/to swing/to move back and forth/to oscillate
to shake/to fling one's arm/to lash/to swing
to roll/to turn over/to invert/to flip
to wander/to shift around/to waver/to vacillate
intermittent/now you see it, now you don't
